column9: When your HP drops to 0, your mind will struggle to continue investigating a <Yellow:Domain>. For your safety, you'll be evacuated.
The situation is urgent! I've adjusted the device's power output to match your vitals, fully charging up our Aliemus!
As it is, we have but one recourse left... it might be dangerous, but we're out of options. Now, unleash my Exalt to end this battle!
Stay focused, <Yellow:Keeper>. The ceremony isn't over yet. You're next in line for a Silver Key.
Erect your tombstone, and devote your life to the fight against <Yellow:Dissolution>. This Mythag tradition marks your graduation as a student, and the beginning of your tenure as an Investigator.
Ready? Then engrave your name. Make it official.
Welcome to Mythag University, %player%.
Or rather, welcome to the world beyond the veil.
I'm home.
Everyone's been waiting for you. In a couple of days, William will assign us our first <Yellow:Cataclysm Investigation Mission>.
He won't go easy on you, even if you're our once-in-a-century Keeper.
Just promise me you won't rely on your <Blue:assistant> for your @1 field work; at least not the same way you do for your Calculus course.
Never expected to attend my own funeral.
Embracing our mortality banishes the fear of death.
As long as our tombstones stand, we're protected against @2's Dissolution.
Her gentle voice, interwoven with distorted screeches, echoes in your mind.
As your assistant, I'll be with you till the very end... <Yellow:May the Silver Key light your path.>
Are you all right, %player%? You're looking a bit pale. Should we drop by the infirmary?
Her crisp voice clears your mind, and the dizziness fades away.
Don't worry, I was just a little dazed... but I'm feeling better already.
Is that so? Just to be safe, why not establish a link with me? As your assistant and partner, it's my responsibility to monitor your condition.
Right now? Out here?
It's maybe a little earlier than planned, but it shouldn't matter, right?
Besides, I've been looking forward to this day for over a year now.
Raindrops slip into your gloves, wetting your fingertips, while a faint current seeps through the material, flowing secretly between your skin and hers.
Inexplicable emotions surge through your nerves—joy, excitement, unease, and...
...<Yellow:hope>.
How warm... the connection is perfect. Your spirit and life force have never shone brighter.
You mustn't falter, <Yellow:the one and only> Keeper. We're counting on you to investigate and document all history lost to Dissolution.
The worry in her eyes fades as Ramona offers a reassuring half-smile.
The sound of drizzling rain fills the world.
But as sudden as a raindrop, <Red:unease, pain, and suffocation> flood your chest.
Ramona!
The bell tolls.
Thank you, Keeper. You've saved me once again. If not for the link we shared, I'd be in serious trouble right now.
Save that for later. Now is not the time!
The pitch-black anomaly spreads around you. Your classmates' screams echo in your ears, as they dissolve into black sludge one by one.
The Silver Key is communicating the enemy's <Yellow:intent> to us through our link. Watch out, it's about to attack!
Protect your Command Device and beware of Dissolution! It will be essential in the upcoming battle!
Hold down a <Yellow:Command Card>, drag it upwards, then release it to command me in combat.
Stay on your toes, the enemy's about to attack. That much damage could kill me!
I trust that you'll make the right decision. For this turn, I suggest playing the <Yellow:"Defense"> card.
We can't afford to stall for much longer. Let's end this in one fell swoop.
This is <Yellow:"Queen's Sword">, a technique I've practiced since childhood. May it strike down our foe!
Do you sense the Aliemus coursing through me, Keeper? Without your guidance, I'd be as mad as Lotan.
However, we can now put it to good use.
Focus on the Aliemus current... yes, it should be on the <Blue:top left corner> of the Command Device.
Unleash my Exalt and enact my <Yellow:"Mundus Decree">! In the fight against Dissolution, <Yellow:we must stay sharp to effectively counter the enemy>.
Damn it, Lotan is about to unleash her own <Yellow:Exalt>... these Command Cards won't suffice...
The Silver Key is bound to your spirit; as such, your memories and insight uniquely shape its power.
Look toward the <Blue:bottom left corner> of the Command Device. The Silver Key is brimming with energy... you now have access to your <Yellow:Posse>!
Grip the Silver Key and chant the incantation... activate <Yellow:Posse>, and grant me more tactical space!
This is... Lotan's prided technique <Yellow:"Blade of Defiance">, capable of launching multiple attacks in an instant!
To counter her move... employ my <Yellow:"Assault Thesis"> . Better safe than sorry.
Looks like you've found your rhythm. The command is yours, Keeper!
Hey you! Quit dawdling and use my <Yellow:"Blade of Defiance"> already.
If I may interject, Keeper. First, utilize the "Strike" Command Cards to reduce the Arithmetica Cost of <Yellow:"Blade of Defiance">.
The right command sequence can optimize our effectiveness in battle. Every choice matters. Think tactically.
Watch out, the enemy is going on the offensive!
What's all that fuss about? I'm here with you. Keeper, let me perform <Yellow:"Outer Surgery">.
Phew. Sorry, there's no time for you to acclimate to all of this properly.
These Mutants reached the Keygrave before the alarm sounded. The <Blue:Mist Barrier> around Mythag must be down.
We informed <Blue:William> about today's ceremony, but no reinforcements came to our aid. The bell... we should regroup and <Yellow:eliminate the source of the anomaly>!
What is that?!
In the periphery of your vision, a blond youth raises a massive black shield, barely fending off a dual-wielding swordswoman's assault.
He guards the pink-haired girl behind him, each deflected attack pushing him back another step.
Wait, the assailant... is that <Yellow:Awakener> Lotan?!
Doll? Is the <Blue:Clock Tower> compromised?!
Ramona looks terrified; you've never seen her this flustered.
The girl, bombarded with questions, speaks in a trembling voice, her fatigue evident.
You recognize her. Professor Doll of the <Blue:Awakening Research Institute>; infamously difficult, and a non-combatant.
Obviously. Did you think I came here for a leisurely stroll?
She closes her eyes, quickly recomposing herself.
The Keygrave is compromised as well? We're near the rear exit. You two should evacuate immediately.
We can help! %player% can establish a link with us and take command—
Ramona. This is our duty. %player% is merely a prep school graduate, still wet behind the ears.
%player% has already linked with me, and I know that {Male=he,Female=she}'s up to the task. I believe in {Male=him,Female=her}!
Doll scrutinizes you, then turns to Ramona with a stern expression.
If memory serves, the oath ceremony was interrupted. {Male=He,Female=She} hasn't received {Male=his,Female=her} Silver Key yet, correct?
We'll be delving into a <Bold:restricted> area. I'd expect someone raised at Mythag to understand what that means.
It's an emergency! We have no choice, right? Besides, %player% isn't just any freshman. {Male=He's,Female=She's} our only Keeper.

Don't you remember the <Yellow:Acushnet Explosion> a year ago? If not for {Male=him,Female=her} single-handedly linking all the Awakeners back then, I wouldn't be here having this discussion with you right now.
The pink-haired girl doesn't answer, and instead, she turns to you.
I know you caught a glimpse of what lies beyond the <Yellow:Gate>; but reality, be it Mythag's foundation or the fate of the world, may not be as you idealize.
We're combating a phenomenon that unmakes existence itself. <Yellow:Dissolution> contamination doesn't kill or destroy. It erases.
Your tombstone inscription, your legacy, will be reduced to a sludge of nothingness, forgotten by all.
Answer me. Are you truly ready for this?
Doll's icy gaze meets yours, her voice flat.
Her face betrays nothing, but deep within her frosty pupils, you glimpse a blazing fire.
Your answer is—
My tombstone now stands as a part of the Keygrave.
You're a member of Mythag. Perhaps you already were back in Acushnet.
There are things only I can accomplish.
The decision may be hasty, but can one ever be truly prepared for everything in life?
Very well.
By the authority of Mythag's 6th Headmaster, <Blue:Oliver Elsie>, I hereby confer Silver Key K-0617 upon you.
Doll retrieves the Silver Key from an ornate case, placing it on your chest. It glows faintly, flooding you with a vague sense of familiarity.
Henceforth, you stand as a Keeper among the myriad of Mythag's students and scholars.
Now then, establish a link with me.
You follow your training and cautiously activate the Silver Key. Silver light flickers as invisible threads tether your senses to Doll's.
Countless images surge through the connection, electric and overwhelming. Your heart pounds violently as you struggle to stay upright.
Doll, you...
Your timing is adequate, Keeper. Ogier and I... we were at our wits' end.
Stay here and rest. Ramona and I will join the battle and support Ogier.
Composure, please. You cannot compensate for Ramona's injuries with foolhardiness. She's currently not fit for combat.
That kid, Ogier, can hold on a little longer. Follow me first.
Stay back! Please... my shield beginning to falter!
With a clang, Lotan's twin swords shatter the black sludge shield once again.
Pathetic! Utterly pathetic! Battling this weakling won't satisfy me! Give me a real fight!
The Awakener Lotan swings her twin blades, relentlessly assaulting Ogier. The sheer power behind each strike makes it clear... she has lost control.
Given the situation, we must...
Ramona, help me subdue Lotan!
You can't possibly mean to...
I'll establish a link with her!
Don't be foolish! An Awakener's breakdown resonates through the link! Even you—
You know that I'm the only one who can do this.
You call me a <Italic:once-in-a-century prodigy>, but the moment a crisis strikes... I'm suddenly treated as if I'm made of porcelain. You can't have it both ways.
Some risks can't be avoided.
We have no choice. With so many losing control, either we fight the ones stricken with madness or get consumed by it.
Besides, we can't possibly breach the Clock Tower's siege by ourselves. We'll need all the help we can get... we must find a way to command the Awakeners.
Ramona, I need your support.
Since you've made up your mind... as your partner, I won't try to stop you.
Ramona, ready for battle!
Activate the Silver Key, %player%.
The Silver Key flickers. An illusory scene coalesces into existence, overlapping with reality before your very eyes.
Feeling dazed, your thoughts slow to a crawl. A siren wails inside your skull. Doll's voice fades into the distance...
You fight to steady your thoughts, trying your hardest to focus on Doll's words despite the noise ringing in your mind.
Can you perceive it? Before you is what we call a Domain. An amalgam of <Yellow:Dream> and <Yellow:Reality>.
Mythag has projected <Blue:Junctions> to stabilize the Investigators' fraying minds and tend to the Awakeners' wounds.
However, human influence falters within a Domain. We cannot be sure where those <Blue:Junctions> are located. It's adapt or perish.
Now, head to the nearest <Blue:Junction> so that you may heal Ramona's wounds.
<Yellow:Silver>? Didn't expect to find any here...
Whether it's crafting Silver Keys, linking Awakeners, or providing spiritual energy... it all depends on <Yellow:Silver>.
Even trace amounts of <Yellow:Silver> hold extraordinary value for Mythag's research. Gather as much as you can.
You can't stop me! Shameless humans...
Your fingers brush the Silver Key. It thrums faintly, urging you to resonate with Lotan.
<Shake:Had I known... I'd never have made a pact with you...>
Ramona approaches Lotan, holding out her hand.
I know that after your awakening, Mythag promised to fight alongside you. To fight together till the planet's end.
We never intended to break our promise. Not for three hundred years, nor the next three hundred to come.
Lotan, the fierce battle you crave is within your grasp.
Hmph, you think you have what it takes to destroy this planet?
Far from enough! Bring it on! Fight me with everything you've got!
Ogier and I are joining the battle.
I can sense through the link that neither of you are in good condition.
It's okay, Keeper. It's a knight's duty to protect others. I can still hold on!
Worry not. With your assistance, we won't lose control and can make the most of our Aliemus.
Once I've accumulated enough Aliemus, I'll be able to fully recuperate my strength.
Your hesitation is misplaced, Keeper. We are counting on you to break through the blockade.
Let me witness for myself the worth of this prodigy Mythag stakes its future upon!
You slip through the hidden door beneath the Clock Tower, stepping into a concealed passage.
Doll marches forward, her boots clanging against the metal walkway with each step.
A secret passage below the clock tower? I had never heard of it before...
If it was common knowledge, it would hardly qualify as a <Bold:secret> passage. This tunnel leads to the <Yellow:Black Pool>... Mythag's foundation.
Without that giant Silver artifact known as the <Yellow:Core> at the bottom of the Black Pool, our Awakener technology would regress decades. Human spirits alone are too fragile to sustain them.
So the restriction on unlinked Awakeners... it's to protect us from succumbing to madness?
That's not entirely true. If all Awakeners were as manageable as you, Ogier, my job would be far simpler.
Alright, we've arrived.
As she speaks, Doll presses an inconspicuous button on the wall. A sharp ding rings out as the doorway slides open, revealing cramped and dimly lit chamber beyond.
The great gate slowly parts, offering your first glimpse into the forbidden sanctum.
Their luminous upper body floats above the black mire, the inky darkness serving only to accentuate Their blinding purity.
Mesmerized, you gaze upon the inhuman entity, Their outline briefly superimposing with that of the young woman you saw while in a trance back at the Keygrave.
They have no face, yet Their stance radiates profound compassion.
The Almighty. The Purest. The Noblest. The Fairest.
<Shake:You... are here...>
The pale monster emits a hoarse cry, roar and wail entwined.
It's not human speech, yet you comprehend its meaning perfectly.
Your vision blurs and your eyes sting unexpectedly. Warm rivulets trace down your cheeks.
Are these tears? You're at a loss. What is this ache constricting your chest?
...<Yellow:Tawil>?
The name muttered by Doll causes Ramona's expression to shift.
Tawil? The Awakener Tawil, one of the founders?
You remember it too. <Blue:The History of Mythag> lists this name alongside two others.
Year 90 After Flood, <Blue:Ward Philips>, <Blue:Khlarcus>, and <Blue:Tawil> founded <Blue:Mythag College>.
Where you stand now. The predecessor to current day <Blue:Mythag University>.
Keeper.
I'm here.
The fact that Tawil has not expelled you yet... it can only mean that your fate is now linked to Mythag's.
Therefore, you've earned the right to hear this.
This is the deepest secret of Mythag University. Tawil, one of our three founders, is neither human nor Awakener.
They're an extradimensional entity initially perceived as mere whispers by Phillips, the first Headmaster.
Contrary to popular belief, Tawil isn't an Awakener. Silver refinement and <Yellow:postmortem Awakening of individuals resonant with the Higher Will> were developed under Their guidance.
They foretold the impending Dissolution, shared the first "Truth," then fell dormant after establishing Mythag College.
Phillips' records suggest that Tawil opted for this "Nonexistent" state to evade observation.
Only when the "Variable" emerges will They awaken—
Look!
As if heralding disaster, "Tawil" let out a eardrum-piercing shriek.
With the trembling of a hatchling breaking out from its shell, six magnificent silver wings burst forth from Their body.
Silver-like liquid drips steadily from each wingtip, creating a soft percussion as it hits the Black Pool below.
As the glinting substance meets the pitch-black of the pool, it churns violently. From its depths, grotesque Dissolutes emerge.
The incomprehensible abominations scatter; some charging at your group, while the rest spill toward the Clock Tower plaza.
<Shake:I have... finally... found... you...>
We must stop Them! It's the only way to prevent more of those monsters from coming out!
Is it... over...?
"Tawil" remains standing in place, though no longer with the same composure.
Before anyone has a chance to react, They unfurl their wings, and lunge at Ramona.
Time comes to a halt.
You move at full speed, barely intercepting in time.
The pale monster stares at you.
Faceless. Silent.
A woman's face comes into view, cold and expressionless.
Her finger daintily taps your Silver Key.
It gleams as it's touched.
You are the Variable, the answer to both the beginning and the end.
Hopefully, you will become the turning point...
The pale six-winged monster. The mud creatures. The twisted Awakeners...
One by one, they melt into the Black Pool before vanishing completely. While the woman with a vacant expression floats upward.
Deaf to Ramona and Dolls' calls, you clutch the Silver Key and stare up at "Tawil," already being engulfed by the "Gate" above.
You know that face. The indifference. The brows. The lips. All mirror Ramona's appearance.
They look exactly the same.

Two Days Later

Keygrave
...Mythag University are pioneers in the battle against Dissolution. We stand as humanity's last line of defense.
For three centuries we've been the bulwark secretly protecting our civilization's future. The cost... has been severe.
These graves were dug in advance. We honor all Mythag personnel, professors and students alike, who chose martyrdom over retreat.
The speech continues. Czort closes her eyes and sighs, her breath a white mist dissipating in the rain.
...I believe you understand the gravity of these words better than any other initiate.
Over the centuries, The Black Pool has birthed Silver Cores and Mutants many times before... but this latest incident dwarfs them all.
Too many never came home.
Ms. Czort is the Acting Dean of Mythag's Department of Biological Studies. Seer of otherworldly beings. The former dean's star pupil.
Dissolution brings only chaos, madness, and death. This is an inevitable burden we must bear together.
You understand the meaning behind Czort's words. There is no one buried in the grave before you.
Black slime oozes slowly across the tombstone.
After the ceremony, Lord Dexter invites you to his office.
"Dexter" rings a familiar bell; it's Ramona's surname. He's your professor and her adoptive father.
About this section in your report... I have a favor to ask of you.
Regarding Tawil's appearance... could you keep that from Ramona for now?
Why?
How should I put it... The causality involved is quite complicated. Not something I can sum up quickly.
But I will tell her eventually; just not yet.
This is unrelated to Mythag's confidentiality protocols, but rather a request from a father who wishes to protect his daughter.
Please, give me some time, alright?
You nod in agreement, truth-hungry but compliant.
Thank you for understanding. Speaking of which... I just got my hands on a couple of bottles of royal blend whiskey.
Here, take one. Invite Ramona for a drink, and savor the taste of adulthood. Consider it your special initiation rite, eh?
Respectfully, Lord Dexter, rest is a luxury we can't afford. The Dissolution won't pause for our convenience.
Alas, William has found his way here. Sorry kid, you're on your own now.
Your dossier is prepared. The time has come, our new Keeper. Report for duty.
May the Silver Key light your path.
